Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Community Connections is hosting a sports camp at BYU-Idaho. Sports Camp will guide participants in the development of life skills through sports. Participants will form lasting friendships while playing sports in an enjoyable yet competitive environment. They will also be learning more about sports related life principles through daily devotionals.

Daily devotionals will teach sportsmanship, character development, and teamwork. The youth will apply these lessons as they are coached by teaching methods inspired to enhance learning. These leaning techniques include exploring new skills, learning from one another, and applying what they have learned in a sports context.

Outcomes

  • Understanding and practice of sportsmanship
  • Increase in skill and understanding of 5 different sports
  • Learn and apply the value of teamwork
  • Be coached through every sport
  • Experience team building activities
  • Application of the BYU-Idaho Learning Model
  • Participate in tournament play

Coaching based on the Learning Model

The entire camp will be taught using the BYU-Idaho learning model, which incorporate three basic concepts:

  • preparing
  • teaching one another
  • applying, proving, or pondering concepts learned

Youth will prepare as they attend daily devotionals with topics that include: leadership, responsibility, respect, sportsmanship, and teamwork. They will take these principles and apply them throughout the entire week. As the youth participate in workshops and scrimmages they will be able to teach and learn from one another. Youth will be divided up into teams where they can learn, grow, and improve together. The aspect of applying what they learned will be demonstrate what they have learned by participating in tournaments held at the end of each day.

Youth will develop many new skills and techniques in each particular sport, as well as gain a better understanding of the sport.

When: Session 1: August 1-5

Check-in is at 8:45 a.m. and check-out will be a 4 p.m. each day.

Who: Youth ages 10-15. (Ages were 12-15 but we have extended this opportunity to ages 10 and 11.)

Cost: $20 a day. You can attend all 5 days for only $80. Price includes camp sports bag, playing time, and sport instruction by coaches in a sport on the day you attend.

Note: Coaches are selected from BYU-Idaho students. Participants will be expected to abide by the BYU-Idaho Honor Code. Youth have the option of bringing a sack lunch or purchasing a lunch at the BYU-Idaho Crossroads Cafeteria for around $8.
